info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 01 at 8:40PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHEASTERN GREENE...SOUTHERN FAYETTE...NORTHEASTERN MONONGALIA AND NORTHEASTERN PRESTON COUNTIES THROUGH 915 PM EDT... At 840 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles southwest of Farmington, or 10 miles south of Uniontown, moving southeast at 65 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Uniontown, Farmington, Point Marion, Fairchance, Smithfield, Bobtown, Markleysburg, Greensboro, Brandonville, Chalkhill, Bruceton Mills, and Valley Point. This includes Interstate 68 in West Virginia between mile markers 10 and 30. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
